intro: Cyphostemma serpens subsp. serpens, commonly known as the snake vine, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, serpentine stems that can reach several meters in length. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by orange-red berries that are toxic to humans and animals. It thrives in arid and semi-arid regions, often growing on rocks or trees. Its unique appearance and adaptability make it a notable species in its native habitat.
